moves.3... c5: Of course I can't take or b2 falls.
moves.8. Qd2: This position is a little like the way I play white side of the Sämisch Variation of the King's Indian Defence.https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/King%27s_Indian_Defence,_S%C3%A4misch_Variation
moves.8... Re8: He avoids the exchange of bishops with Bh6, but I am not sure that this is his best.
moves.11. d5: With the centre closed, my king is in less danger.
moves.11... Ne7: He retreats. His position is a bit cramped now.
moves.12. Ng3: Bringing the knight into the attack.
moves.13... a6: I think he makes a mistake in ignoring my king side play.
moves.14... b5: He continues with his queen side play.
moves.15. hxg6: I open the h file. If now Nxg6 then g4-g5 wins his knight.
moves.16. g5: Now of course Nh5 just loses a pawn for him, but that is probably better than what he tried.
moves.17... bxc3: He takes. OK what would you play as white now?
moves.18. Qh2: Did you spot it? No need to waste a more recapturing. I'm threatening to take on h7 and then mate him. http://gameknot.com/chess-puzzle.pl?pz=164774
moves.18... h5: He tries this. Now find white's move again!
moves.19. Nxh5: Did you see it? if he takes the knight I recapture with the queen and am mating him.
moves.19... Qa5: He tries this, but now he gets mated.
moves.20. Nxg7: I love the way my knight jumps into the position!
moves.21. Kf2: My king is perfectly safe here.
moves.22. Nxe8: It is mate no matter what black plays.
moves.22... Rxe8: So he does this. OK, find the mate in 3!
moves.23... Kxf6: This lasts one move longer than Kf8.
moves.24. Bg5+:
But this leads to mate!
Many thanks for reading, please leave a comment or two and rate the annotation on the star system.
